Like most Wetherspoons it can get very busy at certain times and this converted cinema is on a single level  - though there is a raised area up a narrow ramp towards the kitchen area to the back of the building as you enter. As it's one level it does mean there is less seating available. This means that toilets are all on the ground floor though which I think many will appreciate.
Again, like other Wetherspoons you can theoretically order at the table however in practice I have found that this seems to fail in certain areas of the building.
There are 2 coffee machines (to the left as you enter) but these are a somewhat badly positioned as one tends to block the narrow ramp to the kitchen, some seating and also the disabled toilet which is obviously less than ideal.
The building itself retains some of the original features of it's heritage which gives it originality.

We visited as a group of 4 on Saturday, late afternoon. The pub was very busy as Bury had a football match on and a lot of supports were there.
Despite it being busy we were served quite quickly as they had pleanty of staff on and the staff were polite and friendly.

After a round of drinks we managed to get a table so sat down for further drinks. The drinks selection, quality and price are all very good and typical of most Wetherspoons. They often get this right and one of the reasons I always go back to Wetherspoons across the country. Wetherspoons is exceptionally good value for money.

Two of the group ordered food. One dish was a pizza and I ordered a vegan beyond burger and chips.

The food came within a reasonable time frame. Pizza was reported to be nice but the vegan burger was very disappointing. It was very dark in colour and very dry, it had been over cooked or more likely cooked in a batch and left to sit for a very long period of time in a warmer or warm plate or even reheated.

The building itself is beautiful and has some really nice architecture and decor. It even has a down stairs female toilet (I know, you don't see that often in wetherspoons) and large seating areas however the furniture and carpets have probably seen better days.

If your out for a drink I would recommend a visit, good pint at a great price.

It’s an okay Wetherspoons, but I’ve been to better ones with a better layout — but I suppose that it’s very interesting to look at for roughly five minutes. Not sure that this is somewhere I would want to spend any longer than I had to though lol

Like most Wetherspoons it can get very busy at certain times and this converted cinema is on a single level  - though there is a raised area up a narrow ramp towards the kitchen area to the back of the building as you enter. As it's one level it does mean there is less seating available. This means that toilets are all on the ground floor though which I think many will appreciate.
Again, like other Wetherspoons you can theoretically order at the table however in practice I have found that this seems to fail in certain areas of the building.
There are 2 coffee machines (to the left as you enter) but these are a somewhat badly positioned as one tends to block the narrow ramp to the kitchen, some seating and also the disabled toilet which is obviously less than ideal.
The building itself retains some of the original features of it's heritage which gives it originality.

Two occasions however the breakfast has been very good with no complaints on any of the items.

Also (I don’t use the spread so never complained) most times it’s served with lurpak rather than the vegan spread which concerns me the staff may not be aware of the correct definition of a vegan diet.

3 stars awarded due to 2/6 breakfast no complaints, environment is always pleasant clean and organised, serving staff good service, and speedy service.

I would come again as value is good, coffee is good and would hope quality become more consistent across the breakfast items.

Edit - since writing the review I’ve had two delicious breakfasts with every element cooked as good as it can be (with the right spread) so upping to 5 stars. If your vegan miss a good cooked breakfast and like rich/dark roast coffee plus good value would recommend.
